Posts.Content: Hi Just joined the forum today and wondered if anyone has recently started or due to start their chemo ?
Posts.Title: 2 days into chemo.........

Posts.Content: Hi. Thanks for the reply. I've just begun 6 x FEC for triple negative. Long journey ahead but not feeling too bad at the moment. X
Posts.Title: 2 days into chemo.........

Posts.Content: Hi Eveie You are right about trusting your team as they are the ones with the tools for the job. The Internet is a complete no go for me, I go on this site and nothing else. Only became a community member today and already spoke to lots of nice people with good advice, and like you, as my treatment goes on I will be able to give out the same support. Hope all goes well with the rest of your treatment. Keep in touch if you like......it's good to chat.x
Posts.Title: 2 days into chemo.........

Posts.Content: Hi Turn that date into the day of cleansing ! I had worries and lots of sleepless nights that my chemo would not start due to several reasons but now I'm 1 down 5 to go! Don't feel too bad considering. No sickness or nausea, just take the tabs you are given and you will be fine. Keep in touch.x
Posts.Title: 2 days into chemo.........

Posts.Content: Hi Karriedee Glad you are feeling a little better now. Treatment affects people in different ways I suppose. I'm not feeling too bad. Bit of a cough and tight chest but had that for a few weeks now so just keeping an eye on it, checking my temp all the time ! Yes, I think you are right taking each day at a time. I've rested most the day today so hopefully will have some energy tomorrow. Wait and see, hope you have a good weekend.
Posts.Title: 2 days into chemo.........

Posts.Content: Hi Wendi Thanks for the encouraging reply. Yes I have already marked of number 1 with 5 to go ! Feeling a little unusual today. No sickness or nausea tho. Taking the tabs prescribed so will carry on if it suits. What is your treatment plan now your chemo is finished ? Best wishes to you too Wendi for a happy and healthy new year !
Posts.Title: 2 days into chemo.........

Posts.Content: Thanks for your encouraging reply. What are your treatment plans now ? After 6 x FEC I will have 3 weeks radio as lump was close to chest wall tho not attached thankfully. Mine is also vascular invasive tho nodes clear and even tho the oncologist was not going to send me for ct scans I requested them as I feel for me it's best to know upfront what you are dealing with so the best possible treatment plan can be put in place. X
Posts.Title: 2 days into chemo.........

Posts.Content: Hi GillieB. Thanks for the reply and tips. I too have 6x FEC followed by radio. Will ring my gp on Monday it see if they can prescribe a suitable mouthwash just in case. I have pineapple so will bear that in mind too. Thanks. I have been keeping a diary since diagnosis back in October as suggested by the Breast Nurse at the hospital. She said that it would come in useful when on chemo and 3 days in I'm finding this is really the case. Xx
Posts.Title: 2 days into chemo.........

Posts.Content: Hi ladies Hope you are all having a good evening. Just wondering if anyone has been to one of these sessions at the QE hospital in Birmingham? I have booked on for 8th July, know it's a bit in advance but the first available month they had got anyway was June and I am hoping to bet back to work then. Jenny.x
Posts.Title: Look Good Feeling Better

Posts.Content: Oh that's good. I'm really looking forward to it. Don't wear much makeup so will be interesting to see what I look like after ! Probably won't recognise myself !! Finish chemo and rads end of May so gives me a few weeks to get used to my 'new self'. Take care all. Jenny.x
Posts.Title: Look Good Feeling Better

Posts.Content: Hi Cathy. I have found your post really interesting. I am currently half way through 6 x FEC and tried the no carbs thing myself for 2 days before and 2 days after chemo highlighted by Gillie B on a post a few weeks ago. I too found that the side effects were less, no hot flushes or sweats that I had had previously for 3 days after chemo and no loss of energy. In fact, I felt like I had more energy than normal ! Did get constipation like you but overall side effects were reduced. If you have any other recipe or food suggestions I would be very interested to hear about them. Thanks for your post, it's good to know it's worked for others too. Jenny.x
Posts.Title: Advice re-fasting for chemotherapy.

Posts.Content: Hi Star, I had my third FEC 10 days ago and too had heard that reducing carb intake 2 days before and 2 days after reduces some side effects and fatigue. I did try it and yes, for me some of the side effects ie hot flushes/night sweats that I've had past 2 chemos were not there, also my energy levels were almost normal. I have found tho I've been more constipated this week, lactalose sorting that tho. Getting some prune juice with my weekly shop this week also. I must admit tho I do find it hard to drink large volumes so that may be a factor for me. I'm going to speak to the oncologist about diet as not much has been mentioned to me about it. Jenny.x
Posts.Title: Advice re-fasting for chemotherapy.

Posts.Content: Another here ! Triple negative grade 3 vascular, diagnosed October 2013. Half way through 6 lots of FEC like TimTam, which will be followed by radiotherapy. Hope to have finished treatment by the end of May 2013. Jenny.x
Posts.Title: Breast cancer triple neg grad 3

Posts.Content: Oh ok, thanks for the tip. If it's no better tomorrow I will ring the hospital and ask. Cheers. Jenny.x
Posts.Title: Not tolerating chemo

Posts.Content: Like flute_dog I had my 4th FEC last week and found this time side effects are a bit more persistent. In saying that tho, I too am following the 4 day low carb diet which I have found has helped me regain my energy levels quicker and taken away the hot sweats and flushes I had with previous chemos. Heartburn is my problem at the mo so just eating plain food to try and combat it as gaviscon doesn't seem to be making much difference. Hope you all get some relief tho ladies over the following few days. Jenny.x
Posts.Title: Not tolerating chemo
